intro: Codonanthopsis dissimulata, commonly known as the hidden codonanthe, is a rare and unique member of the Gesneriaceae family. It is native to the high-altitude regions of South America, particularly in Ecuador and Peru. The plant is characterized by its compact, evergreen foliage with strikingly colored leaves that range from green to reddish hues. It produces small, tubular flowers in shades of white and pink, typically blooming during the cooler months. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a delicate and endangered species in its native environment.
